==30 November 2007 (Friday)== * [[Football (soccer)]] ** [[CONMEBOL]] [[Copa Sudamericana 2007|Copa Nissan Sudamericana 2007]] Final, first leg *** [[Club AmÃ©rica]] 2 â 3 [[Arsenal de SarandÃ­]], [[Estadio Azteca]], [[Mexico City]] * [[Mixed martial arts]]: ** [[Sam Vasquez]], a fighter out of [[Houston|Houston, Texas]], becomes the first MMA fighter to die from injuries sustained in a sanctioned bout in the [[United States]]. He collapsed shortly after being knocked out in an October 20 fight, was operated on twice for blood clots in the brain, and then suffered a stroke that left him comatose until his death. [http://www.sherdog.com/news/news.asp?n_id=10203 (Sherdog.com)]
==29 November 2007 (Thursday)== * [[American football]] ** [[2007 NFL season|National Football League]] Week 13: *** [[2007 Dallas Cowboys season|Dallas Cowboys]] 37, [[2007 Green Bay Packers season|Green Bay Packers]] 27 **** In the first meeting between 10â1 teams since 1990, the Cowboys prevailed [[Texas Stadium|at home]] as Packers [[quarterback]] [[Brett Favre]] sat out the second half with a separated left shoulder and a right (throwing arm) elbow injury.
==28 November 2007 (Wednesday)== *[[Football (soccer)]]: ** The [[City of London Police]] arrest five men in connection with an ongoing investigation into [[2006 allegations of corruption in English football|alleged corruption in English football]]. The arrests are focused on the 2003 transfer of [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]] international [[Amdy Faye]] from [[AJ Auxerre|Auxerre]] to [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]]. The arrested men are Faye, now on loan from [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton]] to [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]]; [[Willie McKay]], Faye's [[sports agent|agent]] at the time; current Pompey manager [[Harry Redknapp]]; current Portsmouth chief executive [[Peter Storrie]]; and former Pompey chairman [[Milan MandariÄ|Milan Mandaric]], now chairman at [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester]]. [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/7116823.stm (BBC)]
==27 November 2007 (Tuesday)== * [[Football (soccer)]] ** International [[football team|Club]] Friendly at [[Telstra Stadium]], [[Sydney]], [[New South Wales]], [[Australia]] *** [[Sydney FC]] ([[A-League]]) 5 â 3 [[Los Angeles Galaxy]] ([[Major League Soccer|MLS]]) **** [[David Beckham]] scores on a bending free kick in the first half, but the Galaxy fall in a slugfest in the first match of a two-match tour of [[Australasia]]. * [[American football]]: ** [[Washington Redskins]] [[safety (football position)|safety]] [[Sean Taylor]] dies nearly 26 hours after being shot in his [[Miami]]-area home. ([http://sports.yahoo.com/nfl/news?slug=ap-obit-taylor&prov=ap&type=lgns AP via Yahoo])
==26 November 2007 (Monday)== * [[American football]] ** [[2007 NFL season|National Football League]] Week 11: *** [[2007 Pittsburgh Steelers season|Pittsburgh Steelers]] 3, [[2007 Miami Dolphins season|Miami Dolphins]] 0 ****With the field turned into a murky bog due to heavy rain, the Steelers and Dolphins combine for the lowest-scoring NFL game since 1993. [[Jeff Reed (American football)|Jeff Reed]]'s 24-yard field goal with 17 seconds left accounts for the only points. *[[Cricket]] **[[Pakistan cricket team in India in 2007-08]] ***1st Test:{{cr|IND}} 276 (78.4 ov.) & 203/4 (61.1 ov.) beat {{cr|PAK}} 231 (96.2 ov.) & 247 (83.1 ov.) by 6 wickets
==25 November 2007 (Sunday)== *[[Canadian football]]: **[[95th Grey Cup]] at the [[Rogers Centre]] in [[Toronto]]: ***[[Saskatchewan Roughriders]] 23, [[Winnipeg Blue Bombers]] 19 ****The Riders win their first [[Canadian Football League]] championship since 1989. [[Defensive back]] [[James Johnson (football player)|James Johnson]] is the easy choice for MVP with three interceptions of Bomber [[quarterback]] [[Ryan Dinwiddie]]. Johnson returns the first pick for a touchdown; his final interception seals the game for Saskatchewan. ([http://www.tsn.ca/cfl/news_story/?ID=223672&hubname= TSN]) * [[American football]]: ** [[2007 NFL season|National Football League]] Week 12: *** [[2007 Seattle Seahawks season|Seattle Seahawks]] 24, [[2007 St. Louis Rams season|St. Louis Rams]] 19 ****On fourth down, with the ball on Seattle's 1-yard line and 29 seconds to go, backup quarterback [[Gus Frerotte]] fumbles the snap and is tackled behind the line of scrimmage. *** [[2007 Minnesota Vikings season|Minnesota Vikings]] 41, [[2007 New York Giants season|New York Giants]] 17 **** The Giants' [[Eli Manning]] becomes the first NFL quarterback since 1972 to have three interceptions returned for touchdowns in a game. *** [[2007 Cleveland Browns season|Cleveland Browns]] 27, [[2007 Houston Texans season|Houston Texans]] 17 ****The Browns' little-regarded pass defense intercepts [[Matt Schaub]] twice and holds [[Andre Johnson]] to three catches for 37 yards. *** [[2007 Tampa Bay Buccaneers season|Tampa Bay Buccaneers]] 19, [[2007 Washington Redskins season|Washington Redskins]] 13 ****The Bucs recover four Washington fumbles in the first 18 minutes and intercept [[Jason Campbell]] twice in the fourth quarter. *** [[2007 Cincinnati Bengals season|Cincinnati Bengals]] 35, [[2007 Tennessee Titans season|Tennessee Titans]] 6 **** [[Carson Palmer]] completes 32 of 38 passes for 283 yards and three touchdowns. *** [[2007 New Orleans Saints season|New Orleans Saints]] 31, [[2007 Carolina Panthers season|Carolina Panthers]] 6 ****[[Drew Brees]] throws three touchdown passes, while Panthers quarterbacks [[David Carr]] and [[Matt Moore (American football)|Matt Moore]] combine to throw three interceptions. *** [[2007 Jacksonville Jaguars season|Jacksonville Jaguars]] 36, [[2007 Buffalo Bills season|Buffalo Bills]] 14 ****Buffalo threatens to tie the game early in the fourth quarter, but the Jags follow a [[Justin Durant]] interception with a 59-yard touchdown pass from [[David Garrard]] to [[Reggie Williams (wide receiver)|Reggie Williams]] *** [[2007 Oakland Raiders season|Oakland Raiders]] 20, [[2007 Kansas City Chiefs season|Kansas City Chiefs]] 17 ****Living by his motto, "You play to win the game," Chiefs coach [[Herman Edwards]] elects to go for it on fourth-and-1 from the Oakland 23 late in the fourth quarter. [[Running back]] [[Kolby Smith]] fails to cross the line, and Oakland then runs out the clock. *** [[2007 San Diego Chargers season|San Diego Chargers]] 32, [[2007 Baltimore Ravens season|Baltimore Ravens]] 14 **** [[Philip Rivers]] throws three touchdown passes, while [[LaDainian Tomlinson]] rushes for 77 yards to go over 10,000 yards on his career. *** [[2007 San Francisco 49ers season|San Francisco 49ers]] 37, [[2007 Arizona Cardinals season|Arizona Cardinals]] 31 (OT) ****[[Kurt Warner]] throws for 484 yards, but his fumble in overtime is recovered by 49ers [[linebacker]] [[Tully Banta-Cain]] in the end zone. *** [[2007 Chicago Bears season|Chicago Bears]] 37, [[2007 Denver Broncos season|Denver Broncos]] 34 (OT) ****Chicago's [[Devin Hester]] returns a punt and a kickoff for touchdowns in the second quarter, becoming the first player since the [[AFL-NFL merger]] to do both in a quarter. The second return was Hester's tenth return of a kick or punt for a touchdown, breaking [[Gale Sayers]]' franchise record. *** [[2007 New England Patriots season|New England Patriots]] 31, [[2007 Philadelphia Eagles season|Philadelphia Eagles]] 28 ****For the first time this year, the Patriots are seriously challenged at [[Gillette Stadium|home]]. New England needs a fourth-quarter go-ahead touchdown run from [[Laurence Maroney]] and an [[Asante Samuel]] end-zone interception to remain undefeated. **[[2007 NCAA Division I FBS football season|NCAA Division I FBS]] [[2007 NCAA Division I FBS football rankings|BCS Top 25]]: ***[[2007 Missouri Tigers football team|Missouri]] takes the No. 1 spot in the BCS rankings, meaning they will almost assuredly make the [[BCS National Championship Game]] if they defeat [[2007 Oklahoma Sooners football team|Oklahoma]] in next week's [[Big 12 Football Championship Game|Big 12 Championship Game]]. [[2007 West Virginia Mountaineers football team|West Virginia]] moves to No. 2 with [[Backyard Brawl|one regular-season game]] against [[Pittsburgh Panthers football|Pitt]] remaining. [[2007 Ohio State Buckeyes football team|Ohio State]] and [[2007 Georgia Bulldogs football team|Georgia]] are ranked third and fourth, respectively. Also, for the first time this season, unbeaten [[2007 Hawaii Warriors football team|Hawai{{okina}}i]] reaches the #12 spot in the rankings. If the Warriors beat [[Washington Huskies football|Washington]] and stay in the top 12, they are guaranteed a BCS at-large bid. * [[Football (soccer)]]: ** Drawings for the [[2010 FIFA World Cup Qualifying]] at [[Durban]], [[South Africa]]. *[[Cricket]] **[[New Zealand cricket team in South Africa in 2007-08]] ***{{cr|RSA}} 249/8 (50 ov.) beat {{cr|NZL}} 248/6 (50 ov.) by 2 wickets

==23 November 2007 (Friday)== * [[American football]] ** [[2007 NCAA Division I FBS football season|NCAA Division I FBS]] [[2007 NCAA Division I FBS football rankings|BCS Top 25]]: *** [[2007 Arkansas Razorbacks football team|Arkansas]] 50, (1) [[2007 LSU Tigers football team|LSU]] 48 (3 OT) ([[Battle for the Golden Boot]]) **** [[Darren McFadden]] further states his [[Heisman Trophy|Heisman]] case by running for three touchdowns and throwing for a fourth to lead the Hogs to an upset that ends the Tigers' national title hopes. *** [[2007 Texas A&M Aggies football team|Texas A&M]] 38, (13) [[2007 Texas Longhorn football team|Texas]] 30 ([[Lone Star Showdown]]) **** The Aggies' upset win gives [[2007 Oklahoma Sooners football team|Oklahoma]] the inside track to the [[Big 12 Football Championship Game|Big 12 Championship Game]] if the Sooners can beat [[Bedlam Series|archrivals]] [[Oklahoma State Cowboys|Oklahoma State]] tomorrow. Aggies head coach [[Dennis Franchione]] resigns immediately after the game. *** (14) [[2007 Hawaii Warriors football team|Hawai{{okina}}i]] 39, (17) [[2007 Boise State Broncos football team|Boise State]] 27 **** The Warriors win the outright [[Western Athletic Conference|WAC]] title for the first time ever, and keep their hopes of an at-large BCS bowl berth alive. Warriors quarterback [[Colt Brennan]] sets NCAA records for career TD passes and career TDs responsible for, and he and [[Davone Bess]] tie an NCAA career record for TDs by a QB-receiver combination. * [[Athletics (sport)|Athletics]]: ** The [[International Association of Athletics Federations|IAAF]] officially annuls all of [[Marion Jones]]' competition results since September 2000, including her medals at the [[2001 World Championships in Athletics|2001 World Championships]], in the wake of her confession to having used [[tetrahydrogestrinone|steroids]] in 2000 and 2001. The IAAF also orders her to repay [[United States dollar|USD]] 700,000 in earnings from September 2000 forward. [http://sports.espn.go.com/oly/trackandfield/news/story?id=3124306 (AP via ESPN.com)] * [[Canadian football]] ** 43rd [[Vanier Cup]] (CIS Top 10 rankings in parentheses): (3) [[Manitoba Bisons]] 28 vs. (4) [[Saint Mary's Huskies]] 14 â In the rematch of the 2001 Vanier Cup, the Herd win their first Vanier Cup in 34 years off the effort of quarterback [[Steve Gronick]]'s two touchdowns and kicker [[Scott Dixon]]'s four field goals. [[Hec Crighton Trophy]] winner [[Erik Glavic]] of the Huskies did not participate due to injury, leaving Huskies backup quarterback [[Ted Abraham]], who threw three interceptions in the loss, to start the game. The Bisons end the season as the only undefeated team in Canadian university football. *[[Cricket]] **[[New Zealand cricket team in South Africa in 2007-08]] ([[Twenty20]] match in [[Johannesburg]]) ***{{cr|RSA}} 131/7 (19.5 ov.) beat {{cr|NZL}} 129/7 (20 ov.) by 3 wickets
